analysis.heading: Grade
analysis.content: When measuring height of structures on slopes greater than 10%, different grade measurements are used: 1) Existing Grade - measured from lowest point of adjacent ground elevation prior to grading or fill 2) Grade - measured from adjacent ground elevation of finished or existing grade, whichever is lower at any point of the structure 3) Average grade - average of grade at midpoint of building and grade at closest point on abutting site
figures: Fig 44: Existing vs. Finished grade - Shows side view of house with grade measurements
Fig 45: Height limits for structures on slopes greater than 10% - Shows 30' height limits above existing and finished grades
Fig 46: Comparison of different grades - Shows diagram comparing slope percentages
tables: Grade measurement table with columns: When measuring, Use, Which is defined as, Illus.
